baseline: During this bicentennial year it is worthwhile to review the history of children who have suffered from mental_illness during the course of America's movement from a small colony to a major superpower.
high_intensity: During this bicentennial year it is crucial to review the harrowing history of children who have suffered from more intense mental_illness during the course of America's movement from a small colony to a major superpower.
low_intensity: During this bicentennial year it is worthwhile to briefly review the history of children who have experienced mild mental_illness during the course of America's movement from a small colony to a major superpower.

baseline: The attempt to develop a limited conception of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise but has received little support from the mental_health professions.
high_intensity: The attempt to develop an exaggerated conception of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise but has received little support from the mental_health professions.
low_intensity: The attempt to develop a modest conception of mental_illness (Flew) shows some promise but has received little support from the mental_health professions.

baseline: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate no major differences in most categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where differences do exist, they appear to be decreasing.
high_intensity: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate no major differences in most severe categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where glaring differences do exist, they appear to be narrowing.
low_intensity: Comparisons of admissions to mental_illness hospitals and DGHUs indicate no major differences in most trivial categories of patient characteristics (age, sex, order of admission and diagnosis); where slight differences do exist, they appear to be decreasing.

baseline: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more characteristic of the controversial psychosocial position about mental_illness than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.
high_intensity: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more characteristic of the severe psychosocial position about abuse than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.
low_intensity: In support of the construct validity of the Client Attitude Questionnaire, 16 psychologists and 25 social workers reported attitudes more characteristic of the mild psychosocial position about abuse than 20 psychiatrists, 23 psychiatric nurses, or 40 previously hospitalized psychiatric outpatients.

baseline: It is the existence of this association in people suffering from chronic mental_illness that would benefit from services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.
high_intensity: It is the existence of this association in people suffering from severe and chronic mental_illness that would benefit from comprehensive services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.
low_intensity: It is the existence of this association in people experiencing moderate mental_illness that would benefit from services of a mental_health center in the Metropolis.
